body:
Comment 16: 
Two packages, both built from the same source code -- one built as a command and the
other imported into another package -- are identical.  Their types are identical, their
functions are identical, initialization is identical.  The only difference between them
is that one has its main function called by the runtime, and the program terminates when
main returns.

If you distinguish packages based on which of their functions are called and when, then
you end up distinguishing every different usage of a package by its importers.  Which is
of course ridiculous.
